Ratings.comment: Professor Abate is an extremely easy grader and as long as you follow the format for each assignment you will get a 100. Each week we have to read a novel (don't have to actually read it, find quotes), write a 600 word discussion post on it and then a 300 word peer reflection post. Literally the same every week and the final is just a longer essay.

Professor Abate was fine. She sent helpful reminders, but didn't leave any feedback besides "good work." The class consists of reading an entire novel, writing 600 words including quotes from book and her own secondary sources, and 300 words responding to peers each week. Overall not bad; I enjoyed the content.

Professor Abate is amazing, her class is set up very organized and deadlines are fair. You read a book each week and write at least 600 word paper and then do a peer reflection that's at least 300 words. If you love reading and writing this class will be an easy A. She's a very lenient grader and this class was not overwhelming at all.

Dr. Abate is very passionate about this course and is very organized with the course materials. Each week there is an assigned book or article and you have to write a 600 word post + 300 word peer reflection. Course was very fun to take and I'd recommend it for people who like to read YA novels. This class is easy for those who enjoy reading.
He is so positive and joyful in class. He is such a bright light at OSU and everyone can learn something from him!

I was really worried when I started taking this class, but it was so much easier than I thought it was going to be! Alyssa was an extremely easy grader, and she also offers extra credit. It was really nice, too, because she gave us options on how we wanted to present our books every week. I would definitely recommend taking her class!

Even though it was an online class, she took time to have a one on one by video chat to get to know her students. The course work was a lot of reading and a couple of essays, but nothing hard. Grading seemed a little slow, but other then that great class.
Challenging course work brought me up to a higher standard.  Dr. Moore is a greatly supportive instructor for everyone who really wants to learn something!
She's rather unclear and vacillates a lot. The text was awful!!!! I'm a beginning Linguistics major and I could have chosen a better book aimed at teachers.
Tia was my favorite professor at OSU, she made going to class fun and enjoyable! she was super personable and helpful. she cares a lot about her students. If you can take her i highly recommend it!!!
Tia is the best instructor I have taken at OSU. She is very accommodating and helps if you are behind. She is very sweet and is not very tough.

she is great, and makes class worth attending! I would not skip class just like any other foreign lang. she also gives pop quizzes that are easy if you attend lectures. if u do skip class, do it on culture days. just make sure to review PPoints. Not much outside work:few readings & youtube videos. if you're a shy person, that will change by week 2!
Tia is the best teacher I've had at OSU. She's outgoing, friendly, and always willing to help. I definitely recommend trying to get her as a teacher:  she's determined to make sure no kid fails.

Tia is the best professor I've ever had. She is very down to earth and friendly. She is ALWAYS willing to help and makes her class very fun and ebtertaining. She tells you exactly wat she expects from you, and prepares you well for all your assignments. Overall she could not improve her teaching at all, she's that good.

Tia is amazing!!! She is very helpful and makes class fun. The class is very easy if you attend class and pay attention, with very little outside work. Her classes are very structured and organized. Dont take sign language if you are very shy and introverted. Overall, Tia is fantastic!!! Very down to earth and approachable with questions
Tia is amazing!!! She is extremely helpful and friendly. You can talk to her about anything and she makes class very fun and entertaining.

Tia is absouletly amazing!!! She is very helpful, and makes sign language very easy to learn. Most fun I've ever had in class. Attendance is not mandatory, but if you don't go almost everyday you will not do well. But the class is very fun so you actually enjoy going. She is very down to earth and friendly, and you can talk to her about anything
AMAZING class and professor. Definitely recommend Tia, she is beyond helpful and the workload is almost non-existant outside of class. Go to class and it's a guaranteed A.
Great Teacher, loved her teaching style. Term class really helped material stick. Very helpful, would recommend.
Tia was absolutely wonderful! I enjoyed her so much. She was very patient and helpful

Mrs. Jones is a wonderful teacher I had never had in OSU! Her personality and class is just fun! She is very helpful, so I learn so many things from her. Everybody loves her so much~! At the first, learning Signlangage is kind of hard, but as time passes, you can get used to as I did. I love Mrs. Jones & sign language class so much~!

Tia is great and passionate. If you want an A, just try and attend class. Its defin. hard at first but it gets easier with time. If you are inroverted do not take ASL. Its not just hand movements, there is alot of facial and body movements that can feel very awkward until you get used to it. Tia is the best.
Great teacher!!!
Tia is simply terrific... my favorite ASL class at OSU... She's more than willing to help in any way she can and she is very forgiving on Expressive Exams...
Tia is a sweetheart. Take her if you can. Easy A as well.

Very very kind instructor.  You can tell that she honestly cares about the students and wants them to learn and do well. Obviously, you do have to put in some effort and attend class on a regular basis in order to do well. But you couldn't ask for a sweeter person to teach the class.  Just wish she didn't make us stand up everytime we sign. :)
great teacher, wants students to have fun and learn.
She is a great teacher! She is very interested in helping students and being fair. She makes sure you learn a lot in the class but makes it fun at the same time!
She is a very nice teacher. Her class was interesting, relaxing and well organized. She gave chance to every student to practice in class and encouraged students to learn.

Tia is really a good teacher. She understands that people are on different levels when they enter her class and she works to teach on a level that is good for everyone. She is very clear in her signing and is willing to answer any questions anyone might have. Her class is overall a fun and enjoyable class. I recommend her and the class.
Terrific Sign Language instructor, helpful, and extremely fair assessments.

Everyone in the class felt like a disturbance to Patricia. The course is very unorganized and all over the place. We spent more time doing elementary activities than we did learning anything. At the end of the semester she throws multiple essays on you that are worth more than 50% of your grade. There is no room for interpretation. AVOID!

This professor contributes little meaningful information during lectures. Asks an insane amount from students - for a 3-credit hour class, we had minimum 25 pages of final papers. Unfortunately each final paper has changed many times in requirements and due dates, and are still incredibly unclear. Zero organization. High expectations.

She drops 25 pages of essays (all not related to each other) in the last few weeks of class, and had very few examples of what she wanted in the essay or how to format it. She is a nice person, but she doesn't seem to know how much work we have at the end of the semester with other classes. (Class taken online due to COVID)
60% of the grade was due the weekend after the final week of class. You could pull an A all quarter but then fail the class after the quarter was over.

She is helpful and encouraging. She expects you to put forth effort and will respond in kind. People who want to be told what to do at every step were uncomfortable.Our writing assignments were very self-reflective. I enjoyed her class.

Ratings.comment: Not much lecture material at all. Really only graded on weekly discussions and group projects. He seems nice but his class is only out of 100 points and rarely ever gives feedback. Just do the work and you'll probably get an A. Hope you get a good group for group assignments because those are a good part of your grade. But, he's not bad overall.
This class was so much fun! The professor is amazing and I would definitely take it again.

This professor cares about getting to know her students. She will work with you to make sure you succeed. If you show up to class, turn in homework, and participate, you will do amazing. If I could take another one of her classes, I would!

Dr. Morbitt is one of the most understanding professors I have had in my time here at OSU. She is passionate about her work and is dedicated to making sure that her students are learning, understanding, and retaining the information that is being taught. The lectures are a great balance of group work as well as a lecture.

Prof Morbitt is a great teacher. Her lectures are super engaging and I learned a lot from her class. She doesnt assign an overwhelming amount of work, and she is an easy grader. She always has good energy, is relatable, and teaches us about stuff that is actually relevant. Great prof!

She loves to hear herself talk more than anything else. As other people said, she never listens, refuses to take feedback or hear other opinions, and is extremely rude to students. Honestly the most unhelpful, ingenuine professor I have ever had. Every lecture and assignment was full of meaningless, ineffectual busywork. Too much effort for 1 cred.

Professor Morbitt was such a caring and understanding person this semester unlike other professors since the pandemic started. It's an easy A class, the only thing I disliked about her class was the fact that she made her lectures political which made me uncomfortable. I think educators need to stop forcing their views on their students.

by far the worst professor i've ever had. like others have said, she doesn't respond promptly to emails and doesn't like hearing feedback/differing opinions. rude and borderline hostile, made me feel very uncomfortable as a woc. i do not recommend her as a teacher.

Debbie was awesome! She is very "to the point" and I feel as if she really tries to connect with her students. She wants her students to succeed. You can easily pass her class, you just have to show up to lectures, your site, and do the easy assignments. She doesn't ask for much, she just wants you to give effort. I thought she was great.

Shes fine. Her feedback is kind of obnoxious on papers, but at least she gives it. I enjoyed her much more when I met with her one-on-one (required to do so for an assignment). Her lectures are generally interactive, but I didnt like it when I wasnt feeling it that day. Shes also very talkative.

Only 9 assignments all worth 5 points each. So if you miss one or get a bad grade on one good luck getting an A. She doesnt really like when you share your own option unless it exactly matches up with hers. Only emails you back when its her who needs something. Hope I never have to see her again

really easy class, complete your hours and you'll get the grade you want. You only have lecture every other week. Only thing about professor Morbitt is that she'll call you out for stupid things in lecture.
Awesome teacher. I learned so much. You do need all of the books for this class :(
Great teacher.  I learned a lot of stuff that will actually be useful.  This is an easy A.  She is the best.
Very good. I liked her a lot
No Comments

Deborah is an amazing professor. Read to us before starting each class, Junie B. Jones to be specific, and always had a smile on her face. Text reading is  a lil long, but then again its really helpful for when teaching so you really should try and keep up with it. Best professor for taking this class from hearing about other professors! Take her!

Dr. Patrick is wonderful. She is so caring and passionate about what she teaches. The class is not hard, you just  need to show up to class. She was easily my favorite professor this semester, highly recommend this class!
She is the best teacher you will ever have, she is caring and is the sweetest person out there! Highly, highly recommend, you will never have a better professor!

Literally my favorite professor ever! I can't say enough great things about her. Yes, you do have to read since it is a children's lit class, but I've loved every book I've read. She also gives you plenty of time for assignments. You just need to show up to class. Shes so funny and makes class a good time always! You can tell she genuinely cares.

I have no plans on being a teacher and this was still the best professor I have ever had at Ohio State. She is the sweetest lady in the entire world.  Everyone would be lucky if they had a professor like her!

Lisa was the best teacher I have had in my four years at Ohio State. As a future teacher, I learned more valuable information than I have in any other class. Reading foundations was so much fun and she made sure that we engaged with the content.
Lisa is the best teacher ever.  Her class is really fun and you will really enjoy your time.  Work required isn't much but you will have to read a lot of picture books.  TAKE THIS CLASS
Lisa was the best! This class made learning feel like no work at all, but I still learned so much about children's lit!

Easily one of the most passionate and endearing teachers I ever had. She grades very generously and would rather give an A to everyone than have students fail. The lack of pressure actually inspired me to work even harder in her class.

I absolutely LOVED Lisa! Her classroom was a constant open discussion.  Her passion for literature showed.  She was flexable with turning in assignments as long as you did turn them in.  I am going to miss her class very much!
She is seriously the best teacher I have ever had! She is so inspiring and you can tell she loves to teach! Wonderful Women! :)
BEST TEACHER EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Lisa was such a great teacher! She cared more about her students and making sure we are equipped when we are in the classroom than grades. If you go to class and put a little effort you will get 100% in the class!

SEI.Subject: EDUTL
SEI.Class Name: Advanced Study in Reading Difficulties of Young Children

Ratings.comment: Had no clue what was going on. Did not teach course concepts in the slightest. Had no clue what was on the syllabus. She wanted the class to be discussion based but did not create a strong environment where students could share anything. Seems like she has never taught before in her life. Was always confused about everything.

AMAZING!!!! One of the best professors I've had. He really breaks down the material in an applicable, easily digested way. He is very kind and makes his rubrics clear. I actually looked forward to his class.

TAKE THIS CLASS!! Don't let the 3 credits scare you- I probably spent 15 minutes a week on it outside of class. He cares so much about his students. Attendance is technically part of your grade, but the class is so fun and easy you want to go. He understands if you need to turn in things late, all of the assignments are really structured and easy.

Amazing guy, loved by all. Lent me his Lamborghini, saved a family from a burning building, and he can run a marathon. His classes are easy to comprehend and relatable to everyday life. I have seen a drastic increase in my productivity and efficacy. His class eased the transition into college and made it worth coming to class.

Awesome class. Very helpful teacher cares about the students. Such a doable class, don't be worried about the three credit hours. I paired it with 12 other credits and am at 106% in the class. Show you care and the professor will care for you and get you through it. Fun lectures.
best professor for this class. she is very sweet and super lenient. she grades very easy and actually cares about what your thoughts are on topics. would take any class with her.

Ratings.comment: Approachable, kind, quirky, and funny. Professor Brown was amazing, and I learned so much from his lectures. He is a phenomenal professor, and he also made lectures super interesting! Reading picked up a good amount throughout the semester so time management is important. Also leads a heavy discussion-based class, but overall great professor

Dr. Dee knows does a great job modeling and teaching material that will directly translate into your own classroom. She has a lot of energy and is super engaging. However there really isn't enough time to get through all the material, so filling in the gaps is on you to do. You get out what you put in.
What a tremendous woman! Very energetic and smart. Class was a blast!
Good teacher, was able to confer a large amount of info in just 5 weeks. the portfolio we made will be useful as well. mixes up class with a variety of activities. very energetic.
Great teacher; learned a great deal from her! Very helpful... go to her with any questions you may have. She's a wonderful educator, and I wish her the best of luck!
Prof. Knoblauch was very helpful, and her class was a pleasure. I enjoyed her enthusiasm and dedication to constructivist education. She gets an "A+!"
No Comments

This class was enjoyable, it was reading heavy at times due to the intricate nature of the content, but she was able to break it down in ways that are understandable. There is a lot of reading, and a discussion post for each week of readings. Overall, despite being overwhelmed at times, she was caring and always willing to help her students!

I'm taking this class online, and while we aren't in a classroom, she tries to make it as though we are. She keeps lines of communications open and is very helpful. One of the best professors I've had, even if we aren't in a traditional classroom setting.
No Comments

fun and intelligent. Dr. E made the class atmosphere conducive to learning and discussing issues of ethnicity in terms of contemporary art theory. i don't advise taking this class if you aren't up for writing. there are many assignments but they are manageable and def. build your writing skills. overall a great class and instructor.
Great professor. Always responds to emails promptly, and cares about his students. Nothing bad to say.

A very humane professor who recognizes the limitations and capabilities of his students, in addition to their strengths. I think it may be useful for him to get a more thorough grasp of the philosophical landscape. You can tell his expertise is interdisciplinary, more than anything. Butthat is not a very strong critique. He is sensible and smart.

Spencer Smith is genuinely a good teacher. There are many readings in this class and weekly discussions but they are easy since literally all of the classes are discussions. There are a few papers but not too bad. Hes very lenient and wants us to succeed. Interesting class and material.

Spencer was really nice and definitely wants his students to be successful. His class is composed of a lot of discussions (online & in-person). He takes attendance so you need to show up for class. I found all of the assignments for the class to be easy. They may take time but they are better than exams! He can be kinda awkward but nothing too bad!

Spencer was really nice, but super awkward which made the class very awkward. The environment of the classroom wasn't conductive to learning, and I was often confused about what was being asked of me. The readings were also obnoxiously long, so get ready to read!!!!

Spencer is awesome. He really cares about what his students think and tried to remain unbiased by not having our names on the papers we submit. The classes were intellectually stimulating and fun, and the readings were interesting! Some of the homework requires watching movies which is fun. He really values students and wants what's best for us.

SEI.Subject: ESPHE
SEI.Class Name: Ethics and the Professional Context of Teaching

Ratings.comment: One of the worst professors I've ever had. Does not reply to emails (I received one email back the whole semester, and it was after the class officially ended). Does not use his own rubrics for grading (multiple students lost points for not adding things he DIDN'T ask us to). 0/10 recommend.

Professor Arnold is not good. He was completely inaccessible outside of online class (I never received a response to any of my emails). He is NOT timely when returning grades and he gives little to no feedback on submissions. He is not clear on his expectations for assignments. Lastly, he refused to post lecture slides or recordings. 0/10.

While Professor Arnold is a good guy, I found him to be incompetent. He takes a long time to reply to emails, is not clear about his grading, and gives a bunch of unnecessary busy work (especially after the semester was moved to virtual instruction due to Covid-19). I personally had a bad experience and I would not recommend his class.

I like the discussion sections and challenging but totally do-able essays. If you take them to him outside of class, he'll fix them for you. Take if you want a challenge, avoid if you are just going through the motions of school

Challenging course materials, great lectures, and skills I can actually transfer to my job. Sets a standard few other Ohio State profs can match, so take him if you want to get a good read on your actual skill level, particularly in the education department where standards are fairly mediocre at best. Seeing him outside of class is  your best bet.

No-nonsense philosophy of education that is very refreshing. Clear communicator, expert knowledge. Provides opportunities for Socratic learning. Read all the material, think critically, come to class prepared. Comes off strict but really cares for his students. Took the time to bring up my writing to a REAL academic standard, best class I've had!

Interesting lectures by a funny and knolwdgeable professor.  Class has tons of information that I can use in the future. Picky about essay content, but if you bring them to him before they're due he will fix them for you. I like this since he worked in industry and knows what employers look for. Rickrolled us too. Hilarious.

Definitely designs his classes around the students who want to learn and who aren't just going through the motions of college. Those who werent used to standard homework loads struggled a bit, but I was a senior and many were not. Actually pretty personable--tells funny jokes and actually helped me with my resume when I went to his office hours.

The exams are entirely based on lectures. He is very knowledgeable about the material and his lectures are pretty interesting. No technology usage allowed in his class. Worksheets for books and discussions are graded easy, but he is very particular about essays. He WILL help if you a lot if you go to his office hours for help on essays.

The exams are entirely based on lectures. He is very knowledgeable about the material and his lectures are pretty interesting.  No technology usage allowed in his class. Worksheets for books and discussions are graded easy, but he is very particular about essays. He WILL help if you a lot if you go to his office hours for help on essays.

Professor Arnold really knows what he is talking about and he wants you to know too! Although attendance isnt mandatory, GO TO CLASS! He basses 100% of the exams off of his lecture materials! Also utilize his office hours when writing papers, he really does help!

I didn't think he was that bad. His old exam questions are on his website and he asks review questions pretty much every class. If you can answer them your good to go, otherwise you had better study more. Most people just sat there in total silence not saying a word.  Its pretty basic math to do well on his exams if you just keep up with it.
Learned a lot. Tough tests so you need to keep up with your notes. Knows goofy quirks about the subject he lectures on and will often talk about those in a funny way.

Tough teacher but not unmanageable. Seems to have a lot of rules and comes off as strict in the beginning of the class, but if you come at him like an adult he's more than happy to bend the rules for you so that you can succeed in his class.

SEI.Subject: ESPHE
SEI.Class Name: Ethics and the Professional Context of Teaching

Ratings.comment: We had to read a book a weak, which was a lot but they were easy reads and you could get by only reading half the book. There were two discussion posts due a week and four essays due for the entire semester. Overall not a lot of work and fairly easy. Loved this class!!! Would take Prof. Williams again. Tip: don't buy the books, borrow thru library.

DUDE, take this class!! Dr. Williams is so wonderful, and genuinely one of the best professors I've had in my time at OSU! He's super caring, very understanding and genuinely wants his students to succeed!
Dr. Williams overall is a nice guy and understanding you just need to talk to him, his directions on assignments may not always be clear they can be very confusing.

I really enjoy his class. The work load is not bad at all, about one book per week and most of them are childrens books so theyre easy reads. Quizzes arent really quizzes but rather, what are your thoughts on this.. questions. I have his 3 hours class and it doesnt even feel that long bc the material is engaging so class time flies by.

One of the best college professors I've ever had. He makes the class fun, and makes you enjoy writing. Very clear on what he expects of you, and what you should expect of him. He connects well with the students, and tries to learn about each one personally, showing just how much he cares for you, your well being, and how you're doing in his class.
Works to develop students as writers. Gives good feedback on writings and it is reading heavy with novels, graphic novels, nonfiction, or poetry.
Awesome professor

Dr. Cordi is very inspirational. As a HS teacher I have found value in what he taught me since I could use his techniques with my kids (modified). He is also very caring. During my student teaching he came to my class and did a fairy tale lesson that helped me out BIG TIME! He gave up his own time to help me when he didn't need to. Great job Cordi!
good mix of new stuff, reading and working with others. Really personalizes.

Cordi knows the field.  One of the first teachers I had who really listened.  The classes are creative.  I like the application of the material--I did feel stretched--but in a way I was interested and engaged.  I would like to take more classes with Cordi and I will.  He is always at office hours and shares his insight.  He is a good mentor too.

Dr. Cordi really cares about students.  He spends time in and out of class with anyone who needs him.  He is always sharing new ideas which makes me feel like he is in the field and wanting give us the latest things, ideas and theories.  He is easy to talk to, really cares and always sent me extra information--he is always in his office to talk

Dr. Kevin Cordi was definitely a mentor of mine. He had a passion for what he was teaching and that came out in his lectures. There're a lot of reading and projects, but they taught me a lot about children's literature. He cared about his students and would ALWAYS make time for you. He made the class fun and the assignments challenging. He is GREAT

Dr. Cordi is one of the better professors I've had. He is very knowledgeable about the art of storytelling and the field of English Education. He is passionate about helping young educators, story-tellers, and writers become successful. I enjoyed the hands-on projects he assigned. One of the most thoughtful and caring people/professors I've met.

Dr. Cordi is one of the best professor's I've ever had.  He too time to understand the background of each of his students to better be able help them.  He encouraged our individual creativeness and encouraged us to step out of our comfort zone.  He demanded equal respect for all, because we all have a story.
really new ways to do things.  more interested than I expected.  He seems to like what he does and makes sure everyone is respected.  He spends time in and out of class explaining things.

Dr. Cordi is an extremely nice man. You can tell he really has a heart for his students and wants to see them succeed. The time he spent investing in me during my student teaching giving me feedback on edTPA on how to improve my scores was amazing. If you want a professor that shows heart and drive for you to succeed, consider Dr. Cordi.

Dr. Cordi makes time for students.  He is always in his office.  He cared about my questions---and checked in on me.  We all work together in class--at first I hadn't done that before, but really liked it.  We got to work with other students.  He was easy to talk to and gave goos resources for teaching
cares about students.  Is into the class.  available to help

Dr. C must have a lot going on because he is routinely late for class and cannot remember what he says from one class to the next. If he has worked with some one famous Dr. C will let you know, again and again. He has a great idea with his own teaching method however, he cannot deliver his ideas into a  form that his students can grasp. Decent...

Dr. C must have a lot going on because he is routinely late for class and cannot remember what he says from one class to the next. If he has worked with some one famous Dr. C will let you know, again and again. He has a great idea with his own teaching method however, he cannot deliver his ideas into a  form that his students can grasp.

Kevin Cordi is very disorganized, fond of name dropping, and invested in trendy theories. Assigned a lot of busywork, very time consuming, but not much of a learning experience. Avoid if possible. Gave me inaccurate information re my program.
Very unorganized and assignments are not clearly stated. Randomly assigns points but does not have clear rubrics or grading systems. Easy, but very unhelpful and disappointing.
so helpful with students...good listener...really cares..
awesome!

This teacher is very unorganized. Alot of the time we would have an assignment and he would totally forget about it the next time it is due so we would hold on to it for a few weeks.  You must come to class, although it is very hard to sit through.  If you come to class and attempt to do the work, it should be easy.

The first thing you notice is how much the prof cares for you as a student.  He works hard to align literacy with real life in teaching.   I learned how to extend his material to my own classroom.  Five stars!

I took this class a while ago. Kevin is nice but this class was a complete waste of time and actually took time away from what I needed to do to become an educational professional.  He needs to focus more on actual educational theory and practice and not on flakey breathing techniques; etc.

He was the worst teacher I have ever had at OSU.  He was so unorganized, I couldn't stand it!  We did a project no one understood and didn't learn about anything related to reading...WASTE OF TIME!  Avoid him if at all possible!

Made us do a digital presentation when we had no clue what we were doing. We also did not see him for a straight month, leaving us confused. This class is a LOT of work with a placement in school but he grades easily. Don't take it if you don't have 4-5 hours to spend in a classroom per week.

One of the greatest teachers you will ever have and one of the most awesome classes you will ever take.  It's definitely an amazing experience that you won't get from another course.  You will learn so much and if you're gonig to be a teacher this will help you be a really good one.

Cordi is Amazing. Listen to his words- he's leading you on a journey that may unlock your potential.  The Breathing exercised are wonderful- helps expands my lungs, I speak clearer- engaging the diaprahm is very smart.  If most people knew this-public speaking would be ten times easier.  Cordi is amazing-He should be teaking at Yale.
Very vague instructions on assignments. Kind of weird...makes you do breathing sessions at the beginning of each class...most times I felt like I was going to a therapy session instead of class!
Lots of reading. A couple papers. 2 long discussion posts every week. She is such a gem though.

Professor Klein has honestly been one of the best professors I have ever had. You can tell from the moment that you enter her class for the first time that she truly cares about you as a student and beyond. She respects your thoughts while adding her own insight, and encourages creativity and free thoughout. I recommend her to every student!

Ratings.comment: Mx. Sin is a great professor. They are super helpful in and out of class. The class itself is also very easy.

Sin is an easy instructor and makes the class very manageable. For students with a lot going on outside of school, this is the perfect professor because they are so flexible and understanding. Almost all homework is optional, a couple of longer papers/assignments but I think they were just graded for completion/effort. No exams. Loved this class.

Sin is a great professor. The workload can be a lot, but its a really interesting class so I didnt mind doing it. They dont make you pay for the textbook or reading materials. I learned a lot and I would take this class again! Sin gives extensions, extra help, and is an easy grader. 12/10 great professor take their class!!!! Favorite class ever

Sin was a fantastic professor! They really care about you as an individual. Engaging classes, usually group-led discussions. Lots of reading, but not everything is required. Im glad I took their class! Highly recommended, they are super rad and adaptable, and will understand if life gets in the way of school.
Sin is an amazing professor and if you have the opportunity to take this class please do!! Looked forward to lecture every week and I've never learned so much!
She is an amazing teacher who is understanding of our lives and lets us have a voice during class discussions.

Sin is probably my favorite professor I've had so far. She genuinely cares about you! She will read all of your papers beforehand and give you incredible detailed feedback before the due date so you can fix things before turning it in. She is so inspirational and caring and would literally do anything to help you succeed. She is seriously the best!

This was Sins first time teaching this class ESPHE 3206. She is a great professor who is awesome and always willing to help. Sin was not allowed to change the syllabus due to the university and her mentor. As a professor teaching this crazy/unorganized course she was fantastic. I hope they let her make changes to this course, as her ideas are great
Super caring and engaging lectures. The class itself is easy and I would definitely recommend.

Super easy & interesting class! Timothy made this asynchronous class super interesting despite not meeting in person. The class consists of two discussion boards to participate in weekly + a final project at end of the semester.

He is such a great professor! He is a really fair grader, and his classes are super engaging and fun! He is great at facilitating class discussions in an unbiased way, and lets everyone share their opinions. I would 100% take this class again. Great prof!!

I literally could not say anything bad about him. Such a fair grader, class is set up in a way that is impossible to fail, and is very accommodating. He is the nicest professor I have ever had and he genuinely cares. 1000000% take him if you can.

Dr. Fletcher was a good professor. She obviously is extremely passionate about this material. I took this as my literature GE, and it was nice we mostly read picture books and a couple elementary chapter books. You have to present on a book, but you get to choose out of a list. Overall very fun course I would recommend

Mr. Hasan is an amazing teacher, I have always struggled in science and I did very well in his class. He made it fun to learn and he made it easy to understand. So enjoyed his class. I took his class at Hondros College of Nursing.
He's a really sweet and nice person who truly cares about his students. His tests are fair and he goes over everything on them, and gives plenty of opportunities to get help.

Prof Miller's greatest strength is her willingness to listen to students' concerns. I've never had a prof who cared so much about her students' input and thoughts on the course or the way they teach, and she's extremely receptive. She changed the way she taught based on responses from students struggling, and it helped our grades tremendously.

Professor Miller is cute as can be. You can tell she genuinely cares about her students and is truly proud of our successes. She sends out weekly announcements congratulating us on our quiz and exam grades. 5370 in itself requires a lot of reading, but exams and quizzes are more than fair! Would certainly recommend Prof Miller!

This class was my least favorite of the Health Sciences classes. There are no lectures and you have to read everything yourself. Miller is difficult to reach outside of class. She mutes the quiz and exam grades for whatever reason so you won't know what you got until she releases the answers. Avoid taking this atrocious class with her.

This is probably one of the easiest classes I have ever taken. I swear it was all participation, there is just a lot of homework. So much so that it gets annoying when there are no clear instructions or reasoning behind the assignments, it kind of starts to just feel like busy work. The class did help with my writing, and Professor Wilson is nice.

Although Professor Wilson was fairly flexible in giving us time to turn in our assignments, her feedback was very passive aggressive. She has a very passive aggressive attitude when teaching as well. I just think she could have been a lot more kinder with her feedback as well as demeanor.

This class was an easy A, but it can be a lot of busy work/writing. I loved this class and Prof. Wilson! You don't have to be a good writer to do well, as long as you give it your best effort she will give you an A. One discussion post due each week, we read one book, 4 papers due, and two end-of-semester projects. Great class, would take again.
She is so sweet and nice, you can write anything you want to get an A.

Melissa was a really great teacher and the class was very interesting. There was a good handful of assignments/writings but she would always postpone the due dates to give us more time to finish the assignment if we needed it. As long as you put in effort and showed that you were trying to improve you will do fine.

The class is well organized and encouraging us to have meaningful discussions. There are a lot of writings in this class, but they are honestly not that hard. Overall a very good experience attending this class.

Professor Wilson is a really interesting person to have as an instructor. You're always learning something new in her class which makes it worth it. There are papers due every other week but aren't that difficult. No final but a big project that causes stress but overall an OK class. I would take her class again if I could.

Professor Wilson is a great instructor. However this course is A LOT of writing and papers. For the first few weeks we had a paper due every week. You do 10 minutes of writing every class and use those writings to turn in so if you take that seriously its not that hard. Readings about once a week and no test unless she thinks class isn't reading.

Melissa was a good teacher made sure the class always was planned for the day. No test or quizzes papers about every other week and 2 projects that are terrible. As long as you come to class you will pass she grades on progress through the course.

This is the first class that I don't stare at the clock the whole time. She always has stuff planned for the day, I find everything we do in class to be meaningful, as I am going to be a teacher one day. She doesn't believe in rubrics, which can trip some people up. And she grades on your progress throughout the semester, which is nice.
She was extremely helpful and nice.  Not too much of a workload other than the final project.  She didn't grade harshly and accepted homework that was due on Wednesday all the way until Saturday.

Ratings.comment: Worst course I've taken in my entire academic journey. You could learn as much (if not more) about NVivo by watching a 2-hrs YouTube tutorial. She didn't give a damn about teaching. Came in with 0 preparation and a few times the whole class waited for 30+ mins for her figure things out. 1/3 of the lectures were cancelled rather last-min.

Ratings.comment: Yoon sonsangnim is amazing!!! I truly enjoyed being in her class and even though I tested into Korean 1103 with no prior class experience, she was very patient and understanding and really helped me get my footing. She is part of the reason I continued tp 2102!!! As long as you show up and try your best, she will always help you!

I had her for Korean 1102 - 2102, and she was a great instructor. She has true bi-native fluency in English and Korean, so she was able to explain the nuances of the language in a way that not many instructors could. She pushes her students hard with pronunciation, but it is for the better in the long run. Always ask for feedback when possible.

Yoon Songsaengnim is an amazing teacher, she is great at answering questions and helps her students a lot with pronunciation and sentence flow.  Her classes are very engaging, she is kind and fun and will definitely help improve your Korean if you put in the work on your end.  Highly recommend!!

To be honest, there seems to be a consensus among students, including myself and some friends, that the experience in Esther Hye-Min Yoon's class is consistently frustrating. It appears that there is a general sentiment of dissatisfaction due to what seems like a lack of respect towards students. She is definitely NOT a good instructor

Never gives meaningful feedback and always finds a way to tell you you're wrong. She would tell us certain things didn't exist, but when we would ask our other professor, this thing that "doesn't exist" would be explained in understandable terms. She needs to teach lower levels of Korean first since it seems she also has some things to learn
Had high expectation at first, but she is apparently not the best teacher

AVOID HER! Lecture is abysmally dry, and she dislikes interactions in class. She is also awful in person! Don't ask her any question in class. If you have to take it, find someone else. She is a grad student; she teaches to fulfill a requirement only. Her class fosters mediocrity. As an English major, my writing gets worse after taking her class.
She gave me a zero just because of my late submission

Would not recommend this professor. She doesn't grade anything until the very end of the semester and does not respond to emails. The only way I got her to respond to me about anything was messaging her during our zooms through the chat option. Her instructions are never clear and then when you tell her about it, she says it's your fault.
Disorganized, content out of date, constantly off topic. Had her 2 times for 2 different classes and the experience was so beyond bad the second time.

Ratings.comment: Tara is nice, but her class is not set up ideally. The first few weeks are okay, but then she expects you to read literal novels in 1-2 weeks. Easy to BS assignments and get good grades though. If you're hoping to learn about children's lit, this is not the right class. However, if you're just getting a GE out of the way, it's an alright class.
Carter is amazing. He is so flexible and understanding. I enjoyed every second of this class and recommend it to anyone!

Carter was a great teacher. He really cares about his students and does a good job teaching about diversity in leadership in a simple manner. All of the assignments were easy and almost fun. Readings are basically optional so I really never had homework.

Took this class for a GE. Carter is a caring and friendly professor and conveys the material clearly. Class has a lot of discussion and group work as well as a couple group projects. He very knowledgeable, extremely accommodating and respectful of all of his students. Highly recommended this class or any other class he is teaching.

She made an interesting class horrible. Assigned more work than any professor I had over my 4-years by at least two-fold. I would advise anybody with any sort of time constraints to drop this class immediately. She even went as far as requiring us to meet in person in groups despite it being an online only class.
SO MUCH WORK!!

This class was unnecessarily content-heavy for no reason. It's great to learn the material, sure, but there were roughly 7 papers that required 3-5 pages each. Would take the class again but with a different person. Too much unnecessary work.

Instead of spending too much time learning, we spend time looking for where to write our assignments and where to submit them. You need to submit your assignments in three places, and you don't see any information about it on your to-do list. His class was easy, but he was ignorant and unorganized, I will not be taking his class again.
Don't know the goals of the course. No body tells it clearly. Nothing is useful. A lot of papers !! DO NOT SELECT!!!
The class was only half of the semester. Im sure everyone that turned in their work and showed up for class (once a week) got an A.
Really nice guy class is a little chaotic but if you want an easy A pay attention and do you work. If you are having any problems he always responds to his email very quickly.
Really cool guy. Show up and do homework. Youll do very well.

At first it was very chaotic & no one understood the goals & assignments for the class. It made something super easy more stressful. On the third week, we asked him questions & got answers we needed. He is very nice & understanding, but needs to be more organized.  The class is very dry, repetitive, & almost 3 hours long. Very nice guy though.
Cool, understanding guy. If you're struggling, just talk to him; he will help! Easy class, nothing too hard. Just one long paper you're working on for the whole class.

He is a very good teacher!! Keeps the class interesting. Work is easy just show up and do the weekly assignments and your get an A or B for sure. Also gives out extra credit just in case you need to make up a grade

Great class.  Work intensive but if you need to learn how to write a proper academic paper you will learn how to do so in this class.  Darcy is a really cool guy to get to know on a personal level and also very enthusiastic about what he does.  In the beginning the class was very chaotic and somewhat hard to stay caught up in.  overall good...

Good guy to take class with; easy going and likes to help people out. Good class to help you figure out how to write papers and do well in other classes. A little anarcy at first but it's all coming together now and I like it!

She was not strong at communication and would not respond until weeks later. I felt she was passionate about her work but did not have the same passion for teaching pre-service teachers.
Be ready for long class time with long lectures. Also extremely strict, but you can tell she is passionate about her job.

Ratings.comment: One of the best professors I've ever had! Encourages students to create a presentable and publishable work while in her course. Cares about the well being of students both in and outside of class. Very approachable and inspiring. Encourages students to engage in community service work. Workload is very manageable.

This professor was one of the worst I've ever had. She yelled at students, told people they shouldn't be in the class if they couldn't understand the material, but then left concepts unclear and vague. There was no opportunity to show what I really learned. We went into exams not knowing what to expect. Avoid this prof if at all possible.
Bryan makes the content applicable to real world situations and classrooms. He makes the content interesting and is very funny!
Bryan's a great instructor and is really easy to understand.  His bow tie is really cute too :)
Excellent prof.  Very understanding and willing to work with you.  Challenges you in good ways.

Ratings.comment: Would take any class that he teaches in a heartbeat. One of the best professors that I've had in my three years at Ohio State. He takes attendance and there aren't many assignments in the class, so make sure you show up. He is able to keep the entire class time entertaining and I was able to retain most of the informataion without any issue. 10/10

Ratings.comment: Very tough grader, the weight on the midterm/project and final were crazy. All the other assignments are worth .5 points, yes. So, if you take his course you better hope you don't fall behind or you're done. I highly recommend you take someone else's class

I would not take this class with this professor again- i only chose him because this was the only one open. All assignments were .5 pts, yes you read that right. They will only boost your grade up 2%. There are 3 items that actually matter, and they are weighted HEAVY. Ian is a tough grader. I would highly suggest to take not this course

This was not my favorite class, but overall it was not that bad. The majority of the class is just listening to his lectures and going through the PowerPoint. Your grades rely heavily on the midterm and final. The entire class is only 100 points and 2 exams make up 60 of those points. I would take him again, but it wouldn't be my very first choice

The PowerPoints have very limited information,! The midterm and final are pretty much your big grades without any opportunity to make it up. He never puts in grades consistently. Every week  I had to answer 10-20 questions for 0.5 point.Honestly take this class with another professor, he does not respond to email either.
Tough grader and unfair

Ian was a nice guy but his grading system is hard. There were few assignments in the class so every point mattered. He had one point discussion posts but graded them harshly. The oral reading assignment took a lot of time but make sure you put in the effort because it is worth the same amount of points as the final. His study guides arent helpful.

Dr. Wilkinson is very knowledgeable and caring. He is passionate about literacy and wants all of his students to be the best teachers they can be. There are few assignments, so every point counts on the big assignments. He loves conversation in class and encourages participation. Reading the book and coming to class will help you be fine!

Ian was a very knowledgeable professor who cared a lot about us learning. He was a tough grader which made every assignment a little scary because there were very few, but make sure you put in the time and effort and youll be fine. The course was interesting and he did his best to conduct participatory discussions rather than talk at us.

Try avoiding this professor as much as you possibly can. He was so unaccommodating when he assigned an assignment that required me to interact with a child because of the ongoing pandemic. He also assigned an online group project worth 7 points which was a nightmare since 2 of my group members rarely communicated with the rest of the group

Honestly I would have done better if I watched the lecture videos, but I never did and I still managed to pass. Ian seems like an okay guy, but it was more work than I expected. And there was a group project even thought the class was asynchronous.

Ian can be really boring sometimes, but his Australian accent is fun to listen to and he's a nice guy. He is a bit of a tough grader and expects a lot from you. But he puts all lectures on Carmen, which is helpful. No tests, two papers, a group project, and 5 mini in-class writing assignments. Class is only 100 points so every point really counts.

I found it difficult to receive a satisfactory or "check plus" on papers in this class; difficult, but not impossible.  I ended up with an "A-" overall.  I learned a lot from the class but I found it to be the most difficult class I have taken in pursuit of an M.A. Education at OSU.

Absolutely impossible to earn an A status. If you are trying to earn a 4.0; he will ruin your GPA. He assigns students specific topics to teach the class weekly while he "chills out." Of course he still picks up his pay check at the end. He was not advantageous to my overall learning and teaching development. Waste of my money and time.
Impossible to receive an 'A' in this class.

Ratings.comment: The actual reading for her class is not that bad, however, often times, her quiz questions do not align with the assigned course readings. She requires several essays throughout the semester for which she gives minimal guidance or clarification. Annoyingly, she does not allow you to look at past discussions/assignments to study for quizzes.

Dr. Caldwell does not give clear feedback or clear guidelines for assignments. She told students to follow the rubric on an assignment for which no rubric was given. She also asks quiz questions in confusing ways and has horrible turnaround time for grading.
Justifiably easy class, easy grading.

Great and helpful professor for a very manageable class. Expectations are super clear; on some assignments she will even give you an example of what your submission should look like. There isn't a ton, so just put in the work and it's an easy A.
She was my favorite professor this summer. The class was super easy, but required a lot of work.

Ratings.comment: She was awesome then!!!!
She is very nice and helpful.

Wisnor is one of the coolest teachers I've had! He really does care about the students, and wants to do everything in his power to make sure we become great teachers! He cares about your well-being in and out of class, and is overall a really understanding person. He is respected and very knowledgable about the field of teaching.

Ratings.comment: Professor Thomas was very nice and you could tell she cares about the subject. I took Intro to Children's Lit, and I would say the only thing that caused any issue was having to rent 20 or so books from the library, but when you get the hang of it, it isn't bad. Final is a paper you are well prepared for and there is a lot of in-class discussion

Terrible teacher. All grading criteria is very unclear, and she doesn't actually teach the material well. Our whole class got C's and D's on a test. Instead of self reflecting and realizing she didn't teach the material well, she said "I guess you guys should have studied harder.". Does not take feedback well, and is unfriendly and unforgiving

Rebecca Tang was awful. She spent all of her class periods lecturing about things that did not help at all. When posed with a question, she beat around the bush and NEVER actually answered the question. The class was only out of 100 points so it was VERY hard to do well. You will have to teach yourself almost everythig

Do everything in your power to not take this class w/ her. This class is only 100 pts so its hard enough as it is and she makes it 10x harder. Very scatterbrained lectures, doesn't answer questions well or care if you need a b- and are struggling, Its possible to get a good grade but you will have to put in a LOT of work. Be ready to teach yourself

The class really isn't hard. It is difficult, however, to get a good grade because there are very few graded assignments and she is insanely tough grader. We had a pretty easy tech project with a clear rubric that most groups followed yet no one in the class got an A on it. Just get ready to not pay attention, since you'll get a B at best.

The class is 100 points total, and Tang is a really tough grader. She does not give clear instructions about projects or assignments. Her exams are difficult and her "study guide" is no more than a list of topics we learned about over the semester. She refuses to answer direct questions, and when someone would confront her she'd talk in circles.

Dr. Katz, where do I start. She pushed her ideologies onto students. When we share our thoughts, she tells us why we are wrong. She calls on people who don't want to talk and forces engagement. When I shared my thoughts, she said I was disrespectful and that I should not make those comments. She still does not get students' names correct!

Ratings.comment: Kim is awesome. Her lectures are very helpful and she has a lot of cool stories.

She was probably one of the worst professors I have ever had. She would waste an hour of class time talking about herself for no reason. And spend an hour "answering questions" but not answering the questions that we were asking. I did not learn anything in this class and all of my classmates agree. I do not recommend taking a class Kimberly.

Ratings.comment: Very easy class! Learned a lot about preparing for the future and received great advice from Casey! Very laid back and good sense of humor.

One of the most terrible classes I have ever taken. Not only is she incredibly boring, but she repeats herself over and over again. Very, very picky when it comes to papers. She took off point for the most ridiculous things, INCLUDING word choice! Also talks about her personal life far too much. Also does not curve grades up like she said she would

She makes it so hard to pay attention because of how boring her lectures are. She literally sits on her desk the entire class and reads off her notes. she assigns way to many papers and assignments, and gives you very little time in between them to have time for other classes. Fairly easy class, but takes alot of your time and is insanely boring!
zzz!  very boring! and talked too much about her personal life. way too easy.  doesn't challenge you enough.

Class is fairly easy if attend class. I did well on the assignments & exams which allowed me to somewhat blow off final paper. Few issues arose that involved politics & personal background that I did not enjoy.
You don't need the book, everything is in the guided notes that she gives.  You may want to fall asleep every time you're in class, but its an easy A.  She's very friendly =)

SEI.Subject: EHE
SEI.Class Name: Introduction to Education & Human Ecology and Degree Planning

Ratings.comment: One of the best teachers I've had at OSU. The class is super fun and you really get to know your classmates. She is also a super easy grader. Our class is almost three hours long but we always got out at least an hour early. Very clear and straight to the point and also easy to talk to. Take this class!
Allison is a great professor and she makes the class very enjoyable even though it is online. Reading a book a week is somewhat time consuming but the class is great and she is an easy grader!

Ratings.comment: Four projects due throughout the semester, and a reflection paper. Dr. Snowden gives you a lot of great feedback, if you follow the rubric on all assignments its an easy A. The class is a Hybrid class, so every week that there is no class we had a discussion board to complete.

Kristi is an amazing teacher and actually cares for her students and understands them. super helpful all the time and her lectures are interesting. She shows her funny personality during class and is very nice, and passionate about helping. Absolutely recommend her.

Ratings.comment: This class is not difficult. It is a lot of class discussion, if your class is willing to communicate. If not you will find the class boring because it is a lot of videos and your peers will alternate teaching an hour of the class per day. Overall, she's really her opinion is clear but not forced upon you. You feel welcome to share your opinions

Most classes she just put on videos, and we discuss with each other. There's rarely any actual teaching coming from her end. She also is very slow with grading, by the time all my other final grades were in, I still had 5 ungraded assignments in her class, so it's hard to tell where you stand. She's also very combative to differing opinions.

I thought this was an easy class but I was wrong. There is absolutely no extra credit and space for your points to change once it has been graded. If you are really good at child literature then take this, if you are not, run!

No rubric or expectations were shared. We were marked down for excluding things that were excluded in her examples (eg. no citations in discussion examples but marked down for no citations). She was also completely unresponsive and gave useless feedback.

I learned nothing and was very stressed out. A waste of credit hours.
This class was extremely boring and is not useful at all to non-ELA concentrations. The Department should strongly consider pulling this class from the major requirements.

Said she wasnt going to grade attendance but passed around an attendance sheet every class and graded participation. Lectures were pointless and everyone was doing other work during class. Seems like she knows what she is talking about but communicates poorly. Assignment requirements were always poorly outlined.

Samantha Stewart was a nice person but a bad professor. She was a very tough grader because she didn't provide clear rubrics or assignment examples and then she blamed it on us. She hardly ever gave feedback and when she did it was lengthy and didn't make sense. I wish I had a better professor for the interesting course content.
Did not know what she was doing.

This professor is an extremely tough grader who gives lots of lengthy assignments. She is the only professor 5225 who assigns book guides every 2 weeks which are long assignments only worth 10 points. There are no clear examples for assignments. She is always looking for more than what the assignment rubric asks. Be prepared for a stressful time.

Ratings.comment: I loveeee professor atkinson. She is one of my all time favorite professors. She GENUINELY cares about you and your wellbeing. Content was also super interesting!!
Professor Rieves is amazing. She cares about you and makes class super interesting. Love her

Joe is the best professor I've ever had. He clearly has a passion for what he's teaching and it's so nice to see that. He is also very accommodating and will work with anything that you are struggling with. He is the best part of the education program at osu.

Joe is one of the best professors I have ever had! He genuinely cares about his students and what we learn. He has a wonderful presence and is enjoyable to be around. Joe sets high expectations for his students but is also understanding and lenient. Definitely a diamond in the rough of this education program.

He is a nice guy. He cares about making sure students are learning, and he is very adaptable. You will receive a good grade as long as you do all of the work. The caveat is that there's a LOT of work. Lots of reading as well, so it will take up a lot of your time. My only other complaint is how much he talks about his political beliefs in class.

Prof Spurlock is actually one of the funniest professors I have ever had. I laugh multiple times throughout the class, making it much more enjoyable than a regular lecture. The lecture itself is quite... er.. boring but that is not his fault. I like mr. Spurlock!
Very Boring

Technically he's not a professor I don't think but he taught an in-person launch seminar. Weekly meetings attendance required. He was HORRID - graded super harsh and clearly didn't read some of our assignments. Some peer reviews in class to help us develop our assignments really showed that he was bad all around the board.

Don't take this class if you have any type of trauma. For some assignments you're asked to talk about yourself and your sexual identities. You are GRADED on this, so it's not a "if you're ok with sharing" it's a "you must do this or I will take points off." Way too personal and too much reading for each module. Most of the instructions aren't clear

Ratings.comment: Extremely unprofessional and disrespectful. I don't believe I took anything out of her class. I did not receive thorough feedback on any assignments and when I regularly sought assistance I was repeatedly told that she prefers ambiguity. Expectations were never clear and she refuses to listen to anything you have to say that she disagrees with.

Dr. Manouchehri is overall a great professor. She provides extensive feedback on assignments and is very willing to work with students on her assignments. Her expectations aren't very clear and she has difficulty organizing the assignments for each week. It's clear that she cares about her students and is passionate about education.
Amazing class.
Terrible instructor.

Indeed lots of work. Do not take her class if your goal is to reach the minimal requirement of graduation. A good professor who cares about how much you learn instead of how easy it is for you to pass.
Horrible person.  She has quite a high opinion of herself and let me tell you, it is not deserved.  Avoid at all cost!!

Ratings.comment: Dr. Miranda is amazing. She cares about all of her students and has very prepared classes. She took feedback from other class evaluations and made changes to accommodate what we requested. She does talk a lot and has a lot of power points, but information is easily accessible. She's the best.
Class was okay - just very general. Dr. Miranda is not a very good professor, and the class was an easy A.
This class will change your life, Dr. Miranda is an amazing woman and good teacher.
No Comments

Tiffany is a great person and she made class very fun and enjoyable. However, it was a bit unorganized and she didn't stick to the syllabus at all. We talked about more interesting things, but you never knew what was due when/did you have class/what your grade was until the last week. Lovely person, but unorganized.

This class is great and Tiffany is so awesome! She was sometimes behind on the syllabus, but at the end of the day she always made sure we were informed of any changes. Criteria for assignments was really clear, and as long as she could tell you put some effort into it, you'll get an A. I would take this class again if I could!

She is the worst, avoid at all costs. As a black student I hated her, God help you if you are white. There is 0 organization, the grading criteria is totally her own, and has nothing to do with what she has on the syllabus. She will try to ruin GPA if she doesn't like you. If I had the choice to retake this class or tear out all of my finger nails.
Tiffany is a fantastic lecturer and obviously cares about her students. I would definitely recommend taking this class with her.

SEI.Subject: ESHESA
SEI.Class Name: Special Topics: Higher Education and Student Affairs

Ratings.comment: Very disappointed in the lack of feedback and effort from the professor. Assignments are graded several weeks later, at best, with little to no feedback. Offers apologies for lack of attention to the course but does not make changes to improve it. Assignments often posted at the last minute, not as promised in the syllabus.
Helpful and responsible instructor. I learned a lot in his class.

The professor is really kind and courtesy. Before I decided to take his class, I looked at one student’s assessment. I am glad that I trusted him. The class is not so hard and the atmosphere is quite good. I highly recommend this professor’s classes.
No Comments

Our class on Foundations of Reading just ended for the semester. That was a bit of a tough course for me! Kaha was really helpful in explaining the many theories that we had to learn. I also just appreciated that Kaha was flexible with deadlines, which made me feel like she really cared about our learning and ourselves as students!

I took Equity & Diversity in Education with Kaha and it was one of my favorite classes that I took. She was very caring in her feedback and allowed me to make up missed assignments after I explained my situation. As long as you communicate with her, she is very accommodating to what you need.

Equity and Diversity is an interesting course. I do not recommend Kaha. She did not grade any of our work until after the semester ended. We did not receive any feedback throughout the semester. Class was moved to Zoom many times with only an hour notice. It also would take 5+ days for email responses- many times she needed reminded.

I loved this class and professor. This class is mainly discussion based with your peers so it allows for a deep understanding of course material. While the expectation is to read prior to class, the readings were often very entertaining and touched on topics most have personal experiences with. Prof is very understanding and graded very fairly.

Most of class is discussion based so if you're not ok talking in front of small groups of people maybe not a class for you. That being said, all the mundane stuff (papers, reading, assignments) are completed outside of class so get ready to work. 40 pages of weekly reading is normal. A great class to make friends in, Ivy is a lovely person & prof!

She was a great professor but a hard grader. There is LOTS of reading in this class, and it was out of 100 points. Attendance was mandatory, but as long as you emailed her ahead of time for absences, she would excuse you for a handful. The class was discussion-based, so it involved participating each class period and talking to your classmates.

The class material isn't hard, but some weeks have heavy reading. Starting early and breaking it up over the week helps. Prof. Merry is active, responsive, and provides great feedback. He also offers an extra credit assignment at the semester's end, which is a nice bonus.

Class is not hard as far as material but it is a ridiculous amount of work for a general education class. If you don't enjoy reading and writing a lot, do not take this class. A 200+ word discussion post every week and a paper every few weeks. Most being 2+ pages each. And the last one of the semester is 4-5 pages minimum.

Ratings.comment: amazing take here
Class is back heavy but there are no exams and she is a very engaging teacher.
She is a great professor and very caring about her students.  The class is a little back heavy but there are no exams so it is compensated.

Professor Kearney is one of the best I have had in my time at Ohio State. She is personable and makes class something you want to go to and engage with. Be sure to read or watch any clips before class as it makes everything click more and gives you a better chance at being engaged with class! The papers are not too hard either.

Professor Kearny is an amazing teacher! She takes some complex concepts and theories and breaks them down for better understanding. Assignments are straightforward and easy. I recommend coming to class prepared, such as watching any clips or read articles she provides, to make the learning experience more engaging. I would take her class again!

She is a great professor and cares so much about her students. Her class was so interesting, and I loved to show up to each class. There are no quizzes or tests, so you are just graded on writing assignments that are really easy. In class conversations helped me to learn a lot of new things and they were great to be a part of.

Ms. Kearney's class was very informative and worthwhile as someone taking the course for a GE requirement. She does an amazing job at connecting with her students and hearing our input. There are no tests or quizzes and the short writing assignments are mostly based on personal experience and topics discussed in class. Definitely a 10/10.

Autumn has been my favorite professor that I have ever had the honor to work with. She is amazing at explaining complex topics and treats her students with the utmost respect. She is truly an inspiration and mentor in my academic career. Her class is always interesting and kept respectable. She is understanding and an absolute gift to work with.
He is an amazing professor very understanding and supportive throughout the whole semester.

Very nice professor, he cares about his students. Not a lot of points though. There are 2 philosophy papers, participation and every week was a 1-point note taking. So the papers are crucial. He offers a lot of help though. Overall great professor just be prepared to write and read A LOT.

He docks points on the most trivial of matters. The rubrics are very rigid in what he's looking for, and there's no room for nuance. I found his office hours unhelpful, and his reasoning confusing even after talking to him a few times. On extra credit he will dock points down the hundredths for random reasoning. I don't recommend him.

SEI.Subject: HDFS
SEI.Class Name: Seminar in Human Development and Family Science

SEI.Subject: HDFS
SEI.Class Name: Seminar in Human Development and Family Science

Ratings.comment: She is an amazing professor who truly cares about her students. Yes, GE sucks but she honestly makes it worth coming to class. Her personality and charisma made it my favorite class to go to throughout the week to see her!! 10/10 would recommend
GE launch sucks. She makes it worse. This class is a joke, there is no need to actually grade my assignments. Calls out kids for not paying attention on zoom. ITS A ZOOM FOR GE LAUNCH, WHO CARES

Angga is truly an incredible person. In the education program, professors always talk about the importance of building a community, but they fail to do so. Angga is different. Our cohort had so much fun in his class. Angga would let us take control of the class, make jokes, and laugh with each other. Such a refreshing change from other professors.

Ashlan is such an amazing woman! She used to be a teacher and is now pursuing a PhD at Ohio State. She was so nice to all of us and always gave great advice and information relating to her experiences. She always graded super fair and, in my opinion, was a very generous grader. Highly recommend Ashlan! Definitely one of my favorite professors.

He's alright.Unfortunately, he is so overwhelmed with responsibilities outside the classroom, e.g.,advising grad students, committees, research, he isn't much help if his course becomes a struggle for you. Not his fault though.I'm sure he has to do all this if he wants to keep his job!That's the problem with research I institutions.

I've had Dr. Hirvela for a number of classes and I've learned a lot from him regarding the teaching of reading as well as testing.  As was stated, he may sound dull but for those of us who want to improve our pedagogy and don't expect to be 'entertained' in class, his classes are a must for anyone in education.

Hirvela is definitely one of the sweetest, most unassuming and most encouraging professors I have studied under. The reading load is extremely reasonable. And unlike some closted writing teachers, he brings a vast experience, keen sensitivity and intellectual acumen to the TESOL field. His class certainly helped me refine my pedagogy a lot. *****

SEI.Class Name: Teaching Second Language Grammar and Vocabulary
